com.almasb.fxgl.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.entity.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParticleEntity, PhysicsEntity

    public class Entity
extends Object
    A generic FXGL game object. Any game object "should" be of type Entity. Although not recommended and is rarely necessary, it is possible for a game object to extend this class to add extra functionality.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityType

        public final EntityType getEntityType()

        entity type

      • getTypeAsString

        public final String getTypeAsString()
        Returns:
        entity type as String

      • isType

        public final boolean isType(EntityType type)
        Returns true if type of entity equals passed argument.
        Parameters:
        type - entity type
        Returns:
        true if entity has given type, false otherwise
        Implementation Note:
        equivalent to getTypeAsString().equals(type.getUniqueType())

      • init

        public void init(GameWorld world)
        Sets the game world. Generates hit boxes from scene view if enabled and scene view exists for this entity. Sets active property to true. DO NOT CALL MANUALLY.
        Parameters:
        world - the game world the entity is attached to

      • getWorld

        public GameWorld getWorld()
        Returns:
        The world the entity is attached to.

      • removeFromWorld

        public void removeFromWorld()
        Removes entity from the game world.

      • getSceneView

        public final Optional<EntityView> getSceneView()
        Returns:
        optional containing scene view or Optional.empty() if entity doesn't have a scene view

      • setSceneView

        public final void setSceneView(javafx.scene.Node view)
        Sets the primary view (graphics) for this entity. The view will be used to visualize this entity in the scene.
        Parameters:
        view - graphics

      • setSceneView

        public final void setSceneView(javafx.scene.Node view,
                               RenderLayer layer)
        Sets the primary view (graphics) for this entity. The view will be used to visualize this entity in the scene. The view will be rendered in the given layer group.
        Parameters:
        view - graphics
        layer - render layer

      • getX

        public final double getX()
        Returns x coordinate of the entity's position. Note: transformations like rotation may affect the visual position but will not affect the value retrieved.
        Returns:
        x coordinate

      • rotationProperty

        public final javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty rotationProperty()
        See Also:

      • getRotation

        public final double getRotation()
        Returns absolute angle of the entity rotation in degrees.
        Returns:
        rotation angle

      • setRotation

        public final void setRotation(double angle)
        Set absolute rotation of the entity view in degrees. Note: this doesn't affect hit boxes. For more accurate collisions use PhysicsEntity.
        Parameters:
        angle - the new rotation angle

      • rotateBy

        public final void rotateBy(double byAngle)
        Rotate entity view by given angle. Note: this doesn't affect hit boxes. For more accurate collisions use PhysicsEntity.
        Parameters:
        byAngle - rotation angle in degrees

      • rotateToVector

        public final void rotateToVector(javafx.geometry.Point2D vector)
        Set absolute rotation of the entity view to angle between vector and positive X axis. This is useful for projectiles (bullets, arrows, etc) which rotate depending on their current velocity. Note, this assumes that at 0 angle rotation the scene view is facing right.
        Parameters:
        vector - the rotation vector / velocity vector

      • getXFlipLine

        public final double getXFlipLine()
        Line to flip around. E.g. an entity with texture 200x100 as scene view with xFlipLine = 100 will be mirrored perfectly.
        Returns:
        vertical line at X point to use as pivot point for flip

      • xFlippedProperty

        public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty xFlippedProperty()
        See Also:
        isXFlipped(), setXFlipped(boolean)

      • isXFlipped

        public final boolean isXFlipped()
        Returns:
        true iff x axis is flipped

      • setXFlipped

        public final void setXFlipped(boolean b)
        Flip X axis of the entity. If set to true, the scene view will be drawn from right to left. This also affects hit boxes
        Parameters:
        b - x flipped flag
        Default Value:
        false

      • setXFlipped

        public final void setXFlipped(boolean b,
                              double xFlipLine)
        Flip X axis of the entity. If set to true, the scene view will be drawn from right to left. This also affects hit boxes
        Parameters:
        b - x flipped flag
        xFlipLine - x flip line (pivot line)
        Default Value:
        false

      • hitBoxesProperty

        public final javafx.collections.ObservableList<HitBox> hitBoxesProperty()
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of hit boxes

      • addHitBox

        public final void addHitBox(HitBox hitBox)
        Add a hit (collision) bounding box.
        Parameters:
        hitBox - the bounding box

      • removeHitBox

        public final void removeHitBox(String name)
        Removes a hit box with given name from the list of hit boxes for this entity.
        Parameters:
        name - hit box name

      • setGenerateHitBoxesFromView

        public final void setGenerateHitBoxesFromView(boolean b)
        Set to false if hit boxes have been added manually. Otherwise, FXGL will attempt to generate another hit box from the scene view.
        Parameters:
        b - flag
        Default Value:
        true

      • checkCollision

        public final CollisionResult checkCollision(Entity other)
        Checks for collision with another entity. Returns collision result containing the first hit box that triggered collision. If no collision - CollisionResult.NO_COLLISION will be returned.
        Parameters:
        other - entity to check collision against
        Returns:
        collision result

      • isCollidingWith

        public final boolean isCollidingWith(Entity other)
        Parameters:
        other - the other entity
        Returns:
        true iff this entity is colliding with other based on their hit boxes, in current frame

      • isWithin

        public final boolean isWithin(double minX,
                              double minY,
                              double maxX,
                              double maxY)
        Parameters:
        minX - min x
        minY - min y
        maxX - max x
        maxY - max y
        Returns:
        true iff entity is partially or entirely within given bounds

      • isOutside

        public final boolean isOutside(double minX,
                               double minY,
                               double maxX,
                               double maxY)
        Parameters:
        minX - min x
        minY - min y
        maxX - max x
        maxY - max y
        Returns:
        true iff entity is completely outside given bounds

      • distance

        public final double distance(Entity other)
        Returns distance from center of this entity to center of the given entity.
        Parameters:
        other - the other entity
        Returns:
        distance between two entities

      • getCenter

        public final javafx.geometry.Point2D getCenter()
        Returns:
        center point of this entity

      • computeRange

        public final javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D computeRange(double width,
                                                      double height)
        Returns an area around the entity with given width and height in each direction of the entity + the area of entity itself. This can be used to find the range of an exploding bomb, or area around the player with interactive entities. This can be used together with GameWorld.getEntitiesInRange(Rectangle2D, EntityType...) .
        Parameters:
        width - radius width
        height - radius height
        Returns:
        computed area

      • getWidth

        public final double getWidth()
        Returns:
        width of the bounding box of this entity

      • getHeight

        public final double getHeight()
        Returns:
        height of the bounding box of this entity

      • getControl

        public final <T extends Control> Optional<T> getControl(Class<T> type)
        Returns control of given type or Optional.empty() if no such type is registered on this entity.
        Parameters:
        type - control type
        Returns:
        control

      • getControlUnsafe

        public final <T extends Control> T getControlUnsafe(Class<T> type)
        Returns control of given type. Unlike getControl(Class) there is no check for control existence and return is not wrapped with Optional. Use this only if are certain the entity has this type of control.
        Parameters:
        type - control type
        Returns:
        control

      • addControl

        public final void addControl(Control control)
        Adds behavior to entity. Only 1 control per type is allowed. Anonymous controls are not allowed. 

         E.g.
 entity.addControl(new GravityControl());

 // next line will throw IllegalArgumentException because of duplicate
 entity.addControl(new GravityControl());

 // next line will throw IllegalArgumentException because of anonymous
 entity.addControl(new Control() {
 });
        Parameters:
        control - the behavior

      • removeControl

        public final void removeControl(Class<? extends Control> type)
        Remove behavior from entity of given type.
        Parameters:
        type - the control type to remove

      • removeAllControls

        public final void removeAllControls()
        Remove all behavior controls from entity.

      • getComponent

        public final <T extends Component> Optional<T> getComponent(Class<T> type)
        Returns component of given type if registered. The type must be exactly the same as the type of the instance registered. If component not found, Optional.empty() is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - component type
        Returns:
        component

      • getComponentUnsafe

        public final <T extends Component> T getComponentUnsafe(Class<T> type)
        Returns component of given type. Unlike getComponent(Class) there is no checking if the component exists and so bare object is returned, i.e. can be null. Use this only if you are certain that entity has this type of component.
        Parameters:
        type - component type
        Returns:
        component

      • addComponent

        public final void addComponent(Component component)
        Adds given component to this entity. Only 1 component with the same type can be registered. Anonymous components are NOT allowed.
        Parameters:
        component - the component
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a component with same type already registered or anonymous

      • removeComponent

        public final void removeComponent(Class<? extends Component> type)
        Remove a component with given type from this entity.
        Parameters:
        type - - type of the component to remove

      • isCollidable

        public final boolean isCollidable()
        Returns:
        true if the object participates in collision detection, false otherwise

      • setCollidable

        public final void setCollidable(boolean collidable)
        Enable/disable ability for this entity to participate in collision detection. If collision handler is registered (via PhysicsManager) and both entities have collidable set to true, then the handler will be notified of the collision event.
        Parameters:
        collidable - true enables collision detection, false - disables
        Default Value:
        false

      • aliveProperty

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty aliveProperty()
        See Also:
        isAlive()

      • isAlive

        public final boolean isAlive()
        Entity is considered alive from moment the object itself is created and until removeEntity() is called
        Returns:
        true if entity is alive, false otherwise

      • activeProperty

        public final javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty activeProperty()
        See Also:
        isActive()

      • isActive

        public final boolean isActive()
        Entity is "active" from the moment it is registered in the game world and until it is removed from the game world.
        Returns:
        true if entity is active, else false

      • getExpireTime

        public final javafx.util.Duration getExpireTime()
        Returns:
        expireTime of entity, 0 if not set

      • setExpireTime

        public final void setExpireTime(javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Set expire time for this entity. The timer starts when the entity is added to game scene. Calling this method after entity was added to scene has no effect.

        Once the timer has expired, the entity will be removed with removeEntity()

        Parameters:
        duration - time after which the entity will be removed from world

      • setControlsEnabled

        public final void setControlsEnabled(boolean b)
        Setting this to false will disable each control's update until this has been set back to true.
        Parameters:
        b - controls enabled flag

      • update

        public final void update()
        Do NOT call manually. It is called automatically by the world.

      • onUpdate

        protected void onUpdate()
        Can be overridden to provide subclass implementation.

      • clean

        public final void clean()
        Do NOT call manually. It is called automatically by the world when entity has been removed.

      • onClean

        protected void onClean()
        Can be overridden to provide subclass implementation.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • noType

        public static final Entity noType()
        Returns a new entity without any type.

        Use this method for background entity, range selection entity, temporary entity, etc when you are not going to use its type.

        Returns:
        entity with no type
